In the US, today is Martin Luther King Day. For those who don't know (if you live in the US, you probably learned this in history, but others may need a primer), Martin Luther King was the face of the American Civil Rights movement, which ended segregation and increased harmony between white people and African-Americans. He is most known for his "I Have A Dream" speech, which you can read here.

Mods, you may lock this thread to avoid stupidity if you think it is likely to result.
